intro: Melandrium chilense, commonly known as the Chilean catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in regions with temperate climates. It has small, hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Melandrium chilense is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
